required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of Acute Red Raspberry Consumption on Vascular Function in Healthy Individuals
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Acute Red Raspberry Consumption on Vascular Function in Healthy Individuals

brief_summary.textblock: Accumulating evidence from epidemiological and human intervention studies indicates that the cardiovascular health benefits of diets rich in fruits and vegetables are (in part) related to their (poly)phenol content. Raspberries are rich in phenolic and polyphenolic compounds, in particular procyanidins, ellagitannins and anthocyanins, but also phenolic acids. At present, a small number of randomized controlled trials investigating the effects of berry (poly)phenols on validated surrogate markers of cardiovascular disease risk have shown promising results. However, to date, very few human studies have specifically investigated the effects of raspberry (poly)phenols on cardiovascular function in healthy subjects. Moreover, ellagitannin-derived metabolites are believed to persist for a long period of time in the blood and urine. Therefore, the investigators will investigate the presence of plasma and urinary raspberry-derived metabolites 24h post-consumption. To the investigators knowledge, the effects of red raspberry consumption on vascular function in humans have not been investigated before. This information is necessary for the planning of long-term studies aiming to assess the potential beneficial effects of raspberries,. Therefore, this study aims to investigate the potential role of red raspberry (poly)phenols in the modulation of vascular function by monitoring changes in vascular function together with the major (poly)phenol derivatives/metabolites in plasma.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline to 2 hour and 24 hour in Endothelial function
primary_outcome.description: measured by flow mediated dilation (FMD) on baseline at 2 and 24 hour postconsumption

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline to 2 hour and 24 hour in Pulse wave velocity
secondary_outcome.description: measured by sphygmomanometer SphygmoCor on baseline at 2 and 24 hours postconsumption

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline to 2 hour and 24 hour in Central blood pressure
secondary_outcome.description: measured by sphygmomanometer SphygmoCor on baseline at 2 and 24 hours postconsumption
measured by automatic sphygmomanometer on baseline at 2 and 24 hours postconsumption

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline to 2 hour and 24 hour in Heart rate
secondary_outcome.description: measured by SphygmoCor on baseline at 2 and 24 hours postconsumption

other_outcome.measure: Change from baseline to 2 hour and 24 hour in Polyphenol metabolites in blood plasma
other_outcome.description: measured by ultra-performance liquid chromatography/quadrupole-time-of-flight mass-spectrometry (UPLC-Q-TOF MS ) on baseline at 2 and 24 hours postconsumption

other_outcome.measure: Change from baseline to 2 hour and 24 hour in Polyphenol metabolites in urine
other_outcome.description: measured by ultra-performance liquid chromatography/quadrupole-time-of-flight mass-spectrometry (UPLC-Q-TOF MS ) on baseline at 2 and 24 hours postconsumption

arm_group.description: Red raspberry beverage Acute intake of 600 mL (1x daily)
Red raspberry beverage Acute intake of 600 mL (1x daily)
Raspberry deprived supplement Acute intake of 600 mL (1x daily)

intervention.description: 1x daily intake of 600 mL red raspberry beverage
1x daily intake of 600 mL red raspberry beverage
1x daily intake of 600 mL raspberry deprived supplement

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- healthy male subjects (no clinical signs or symptoms of cardiovascular disease)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Cardiovascular disease
- acute inflammation
- cardiac arrhythmia
- renal failure
- heart failure (NYHA II-IV)
- diabetes mellitus
- C - reactive protein > 05 mg/dL
- malignant disease
- raspberry allergy/intolerance
- hypotension (â‰¤100 / 60 mm Hg)
